alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Henry; Patrick; Pittsylvania (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 03 at 9:19PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Showers and isolated thunderstorms with gusty winds will impact portions of western Pittsylvania, Henry, eastern Patrick and southeastern Franklin Counties and the City of Martinsville through 945 PM EST... At 918 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking showers and isolated thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bassett to near Sanville to near Sandy Ridge. Movement was east at 70 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Martinsville... Axton... Penhook... Spencer... Callands... Bassett... and Sydnorsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
